result.execSummary:
All charges against Anthony E. Anderson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony E. Anderson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony E. Anderson

Date and time set for preliminary hearing.

COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J.

cc: Branch 4.

Date and time set for preliminary hearing.

COURT finds good cause to toll time limits.

Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
